1.title: Failure - The Key to Success?
1.plot: Jessie speaks to 'the' Daniel Northman for the first time - and makes a complete idiot of herself. She accepts Katie's challenge to stay single and, despite being haunted by her ex (Jason) who seems to think that room-hopping is the new bed-hopping, is confident she can stay single for 90 days.

2.title: Presidential Sweeet
2.plot: Room mix-ups are the bane of Jessie's life this week. Jason loses Jessie's master key when he slips into the wrong room and climbs into bed with a Mr & Mrs Collins. Adam Brightman, gorgeous media mogul, isn't pleased about the double booking with his long-term stay in the Presidential Suite.

3.title: Oh Oh Seven
3.plot: Jessie unsubscribes from all 7 dating sites, Katie promises a trip to Vegas if she can complete the challenge. There's a lot of buzz about Daniel Northman, the new walking talking 'Bond' bar manager, but Jessie's neither shaken nor stirred by all that...

4.title: The Only Way Is UP(S)
4.plot: So, who knew? Jessie has a secret admirer? It's all very exciting (if not really bad timing - she's only 1 week in). He sent a courier with a box and guess what was inside? A phone. Which proceeded to 'ping' immediately with some really funny and slightly naughty text messages. Jessie isn't sure if it's 'flirting' if she replies but doesn't know who she's talking to?

5.title: Game On
5.plot: Jessie meets Daniel Northman for the first time when dealing with a problem in the lobby. He was obnoxious but gorgeous. They say there's a thin line between love and hate, right? Anyway, he knows about Jason. And more.

6.title: Act Like a Lady
6.plot: Katie sets Jessie an additional challenge to watch 24 of her favorite romantic movies to remember what romance should be. Meanwhile Jessie's been thinking about her boxes - the ones that you'd like ticked in the perfect partner. And Adam? Well, she acted like an idiot.

7.title: Tulips from Adam(Sterdam)
7.plot: Jessie receives tulips from Adam(sterdam) and she's surprised after being such a klutz. Her secret admirer has begun emailing, texting and sends another parcel with that really cute courier. Jessie is counting the days. 68 to go.

8.title: Rainy Day Strategy
8.plot: Mini-bar incidents are so common in hotels. Really, you wouldn't believe some of the scenarios they have to deal with at The Chatsfield. Daniel Northman has been emailing Jessie strange umbrella stories, thinking that she has a protective 'brolly' as a forcefield to stop herself from getting hurt. She was crazy to even think of telling him about her 'challenge' (that he's now obsessed with calling her 'Tough Mudder').

9.title: Every Cloud
9.plot: Finally. 5 weeks late and Jason returns Jessies laptop - along with a newly installed folder. Today was a bad day and Jessie slouches in bed, stuffing her face with chocolates as she tries to Sherlock and find Northman - but could really do with some help.

10.title: Feet on the Ground
10.plot: Jessie receives more tulips from Adam, that cheers her up on a morning when she trips over the mat with Dan watching. It's been a rollercoaster, highs of tulips, embarrassment of mat trip, then along comes Chase (the cute courier) with yet another parcel. Jessie thinks she knows who it is though.

11.title: When Is a Date Not a Date
11.plot: What kind of job makes it compulsory that you attend a Singles Evening at the end of a long day? Jessie struggles to convince Lucilla that she doesn't have to go as she's promised to be date-free until the end of July! But Jessie ponders 'dating'. What does it mean? Dating... She's a little confused.

12.title: Happy Dance
12.plot: So. 1 month down and Jessie receives congratulatory gifts. She's secretly proud of her achievement, what with her secret admirer, her weekly tulips and the intrigue around the elusive Daniel Northman.

13.title: Love in an Elevator
13.plot: What a horrible day. Jessie sometimes I can't believe what an idiot she is after an 'incident' in the lift. She pouted. And closed her eyes. It gets worse. He sent up Ally, my new chambermaid friend, with more cherries and a note.

14.title: High Roller
14.plot: Sometimes an apology really is sufficient. But other times it barely scratches the surface. A gift box from Katie cheers Jessie up though. 1 month closer to Vegas, baby.

15.title: Sheep in Wolves Clothing
15.plot: So, Dan and Jessie argue. She's not impressed with what she's found out about him and, in a week when she's already feeling low and thinking about Laura, his behavior is only making things a zillion times worse. He has no idea what Jessie has been battling with.

16.title: A Closet Full of Lies
16.plot: Jessie is in reflective mode, pondering over how people change when they get comfortable in a relationship. Clearly Mrs Hamilton-Smythe remains out of her comfort zone, given what she left behind in her room. That's the fun of working in a hotel. The daily evidence that people are rarely what they seem.

17.title: The Hangover
17.plot: Hangover cure? Anyone? Jessie thought it would be fun to let her hair down last night (although Dan is enjoying reminding her that she's 'not Rapunzel')... Looks like a long day ahead.

18.title: Friggatriskaidekaphobia
18.plot: Friday 13th. Jessie's not usually superstitious but the way her luck is going lately, anything could happen today. Dan is already teasing her about not putting her umbrella up indoors while Lucilla's brother, Lucca, is causing another scandal. Jason has a new girlfriend and he's taking it all very seriously.

19.title: Wrecking Ball
19.plot: Jessie meets Tammy - Jason's new 'girlfriend'. She is awful but at least she's taken Jessie off of his radar. Jessie spends some quality time with Dan and they share a moment. She tells him about Laura and they start to. - talk.

20.title: Cookie Monster
20.plot: Jessie is lured into a false sense of security and now regrets telling Dan too much. She's worried that she was rude to Chase and she's certain she knows who her secret admirer is.

21.title: Living La Vida Loca
21.plot: Jessie's Mum is embarrassing her on Facebook. She decides she needs some fun and hits the town with Ally, who has been up to some seriously naughty stuff and has some inside info on Daniel 'Bond' Northman.

22.title: The More Things Change
22.plot: Ally Gregory had a lot of money on her last night. They had an amazing night and Jessie learned a few things (mostly about her Zumba moves and how they translate to a dance floor). Jessie dreads the next Chatsfield Exclusive Singles Evening.

23.title: I Need a Clyde
23.plot: Chase is back with yet another secret admirer parcel and Jessie is a step towards finding out who it is, although she's not sure she wants to. A viewing of Bonnie and Clyde helps her see the light. It's what she needs. A partner in crime.. A Clyde.

24.title: The 'Man' in Manage
24.plot: Jessie goes to the singles evening. Jason arrived, feeling sorry for himself after splitting with Tammy but determined to 'get back in the saddle'. Jessie helps him out with a spareroom, but realises how much she's toughened up.

25.title: Two Out of Three
25.plot: 2 months in and Jessie's feeling good. She's in selfie overload, putting a stop to Adam's floral shenanigans and generally taking control of her life. If only she wasn't so confused about other things.

26.title: Blue Eyes Green
26.plot: One thing that's great about working for Lucilla is that Jessie has her own office. Which means, when she needs to work late she can still watch a movie, grab a drink and do her own thing. She's decided she definitely knows who 'sekritadmirer' is.

27.title: Miss Independent
27.plot: 4th July and Jessie's in love with American Independence Day at The Chatsfield. Amongst the US themed cocktail parties she questions her own freedom and state of independence.. - while she notices those Spanish guys in the bar acting very strangely.

28.title: Incommunicado
28.plot: Things progress. Adam finally gets the message although he still wants to 'talk'. And she's onto Dan and the whole 'Save The Date' thing.

29.title: Sekrit Admirer
29.plot: Jessie has a long chat with Dan and he's in turmoil. He won't admit anything to do with the whole secret admirer thing, but she's definitely making progress. And Chase arrived - but with no parcel. Now that seemed weird.

30.title: Tough Love Muffin
30.plot: Jason finally gets the message and leaves Jessie a gift and a thank you note. Jessie's still confused about many things - the Spanish, Ally's emails, secret admirer text messages and what on earth Dan is up to?

31.title: Caught in a Trap
31.plot: Jessie has a guest with a mouse problem. Oh, and Premiership footballers arriving to cause chaos. Her day is filled with emergency management meetings, exaggerated rodent problems, huge egos and discoveries of things not being what they seem.

32.title: The Set Up
32.plot: Jessie's worst day. Ever. She spends the day in bed, feeling stupid, betrayed, humiliated.

33.title: Boomerang Girl
33.plot: Jessie is upset and suspects she's the 'boomerang girl' that Katie accused me of being? Like something is about to erupt.

34.title: A Girl's Gotta Do
34.plot: There goes the eruption. Police raids, arrests, angry hotel managers, stressed bosses and a lot of things that ricochet off of a police bust in the bar. It's exciting, but sort of, not... It's different when people you care about are caught up in the crossfire.

35.title: The Umbrella Plant
35.plot: Jessie visits Dan in hospital as he puts on a brave face, but says it's worth it. Jessie becomes the proud new owner of - an umbrella plant. as things turn quite a significant corner.

36.title: Penthouse & Pasta
36.plot: Jessie finds herself spending the day Maida Vale, unexpectedly.. Neither had she expected she'd been rustling up pasta in a penthouse. But hey, roll with the punches, right? At least that's what Dan keeps saying but she knows he's being sarcastic.

37.title: Too Many Boxes
37.plot: Jessie's at the end of her challenge and reflects over what she's learned about herself and things that have happened that she simply couldn't have predicted.

38.title: Future's So Bright
38.plot: Jessie's challenge is complete and she's now faced with a series of options and needs time to think. Vegas is one, but there are others on the table and she wants to do the right thing. The future is bright.

39.title: Out of Office
39.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

locations: St James Court Hotel, Buckingham Gate, Westminster, London, England, UK::(The Chatsfield Hotel)
imdb.title: The Loedown
synopsis: The Loedown is a web series introducing Jessie Loe, Exec PA at The Chatsfield Hotel, self-professed 'unlucky in love, glass half-full, dating expert', as she accepts a challenge from her New Yorker friend, Katie Jones, to remain single for 3 months.Hopelessly romantic and yet feisty, Jessie finds herself on a quest to prove her friends wrong when they label her a 'pleaser' and to prove to herself that she's not turning into a commitment-phobe.Aware that she's the ultimate cliche - a commitment-phobe who can't say no - she embarks on her quest, only to be suddenly surrounded by a series of guys who, collectively, tick all of her boxes.
